citation.article-title: Kaistella koreensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the Chryseobacterium-Bergeyella-Riemerella branch.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Kaistella (Ka.is.tel′la. L. dim. suff. -ella; N.L. fem. n. Kaistella arbitrary name after KAIST, Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology).
Colonies are circular, entire, low-convex, smooth, opaque and yellow.
Nitrate is not reduced to N2.
Indole is produced and acid is not produced from glucose.
Arginine dihydrolase and β-galactosidase are negative.
At present, it is not possible to give a general biochemical profile for the genus as only a single species is known.
The DNA base composition ranges from 41·2 to 41·6 mol% G+C.
The major isoprenoid quinone is MK-6.
The type species is Kaistella koreensis.
